full_text:
Dr. R. B. Seligman
August 4, 1964
H. C. Silberman
Meeting with Mr. Howard Kothe
On July 28, 1964, I visited Mr. Kothe at his office in
New York to discuss enzyme work.
Mr. Kothe confirmed our opinion that our new work on smoke
modification by enzymes is not eovered by our patent application
PM 393. He advised that in the future we submit to him drafts
of proposed letters to Rohm and Haas. He also advised to use
enzymes from other manufacturers as well as those from Rohm and
Haas in our evaluations.
On his next trip to Washington, Mr. Kothe will try to get all
the information on file about US 3, 132, 65l, by Julius E, Kiefer,
smoking products and manufacture of the same. This patent issued
on May 12, 1964, covers the use of enzyme preparations without
havingany example or proof for the claims.
/sjm
